title: England stars issue brilliant response and show racists they won't be beaten
text:

The sad part is that no-one will remember the football.

No-one will remember the emphatic victory, Ross Barkley’s man-of-the-match performance, Marcus Rashford’s stunning strike or even Raheem Sterling’s brilliant brace.

Everyone will remember it for a night that shamed football when, somehow, amid appalling scenes, England’s footballers kept going while a section of Bulgaria’s fans disgraced their country.

We have talked so much about what potentially might happen that maybe we should not have been surprised.

But it still took your breath away, you still looked on from the stands shell-shocked that it could happen in this day and age.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

(Image: PA)

England’s players did not walk off, it looked like they would at one point but they won it on the pitch, making their point on a night which must serve as a warning to UEFA that banners, warnings and paltry fines are not working.

Sadly, we will do well to remember the result but the travelling fans did cheer and give a chorus of “oles” as England stroked the ball around for fun with Bulgaria chasing shadows. It looked like the Bulgarian players had given up, embarrassed by the whole night.

England showed they could still play even when the racists were trying to drag them down with a result which humiliated their hosts. The England fans chanted: “Who put the ball in the racists’ net… Raheem Sterling.”

It was their answer.

(Image: Getty Images)

And more than that, the players showed real character to overcome the horrible circumstances even when Gareth Southgate, the referee and the officials looked ready to lead the players off with everyone looking confused as to what happens next.

But it really felt England’s players were on a mission to show nothing would stop them.

Tyrone Mings was subjected to monkey chants which marred his full debut, Sterling was jeered and yet England were not distracted from the job in hand.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

The worries from England’s demoralising defeat in Czech Republic on Friday night quickly disappeared when Rashford put them ahead after just seven minutes with a goal of the highest quality to end his 12 game bought for club and country.

Ross Barkley made an important interception on the left edge of the penalty box, Rashford picked up the loose ball, beat Kiril Despodov and then turned Georgi Pashov inside out. Rashford then hit an unstoppable shot which left Bulgaria keeper Plamen Iliev clutching at thin air.

Meanwhile, the disgraceful chanting was going on but England kept playing. The second goal came after 20 minutes when Sterling and Harry Kane swapped passes, Sterling broke into the box and his low cross was turned in at the back post by Barkley.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

England got a third after 32 minutes. Kane turned provider again as his cross was perfect for Barkley who drifted into the box with perfect timing before glancing home. Barkley has been a reliable midfielder for Southgate and he surely cannot drop him again.

In the fourth minute of stoppage time at the end of the first half, Kane’s cross was turned home by Sterling after a nice flowing move.

No-one was really thinking about the football by now as the game was twice stopped but England always kept going.

Bulgaria seemed to get rid of the worst offenders from one section of the ground, captain Ivelin Popov spoke at length to home fans at half time and the teams re-emerged for the second half looking as if they had decided just to get this horrible night over and done with.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Sterling twice went close before eventually getting his second after 69 minutes. Kane put Sterling through, the Manchester City star slotted it past the keeper and that made it five.

It was a night to shame football but one in which England’s players showed they will not let the racists win.

England captain Kane showed his leadership qualities on a difficult night, he had unselfishly set up team mates but finally got his own reward with the sixth in the 86th minute as he swept home.

A huge win on a dreadful night.
description: BULGARIA 0-6 ENGLAND: The Three Lions were excellent - but unfortunately no-one will remember their performance
